website_summaries.verdict: There's a reason the classic camping stove still has raving fans, thanks to an attractive price point and lots of features.
pros: Can fit both 10- and 12-inch pans on burners at the same time
strong enough for even cast iron pans
Takes only a few minutes to boil water
Users have found this a fantastic backup stove in case of bad weather or blackouts
cons: No feet on stove, so should be used on a non-flammable surface
Not too many nuances when it comes to flame: either high or low

website_summaries.verdict: A portable, low-priced option that does a decent job of grilling along with other forms of cooking.
pros: Extremely portable with a slim and narrow profile for easy carrying and storage
Can hold a couple of pans at the same time
cons: Lack of dedicated grilling can make some meats harder to cook

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made product.
customer_reviews.text: This is not the old Coleman products we all knew from past camping. fishing etc. The metal side wind shields are made cheap and one of the brads holding one side on was already broken when received. The other side and any similar fasteners would not have lasted either. Sorry to say cannot recommend and sorry to see a great name fall to this sort of manufacturing. Returned to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Harlon Pickett

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm! I love this classic stove! It's so easy to light and works amazingly with my cast iron pan!
customer_reviews.author: Toni Connell

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed because I trusted the Coleman brand
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these and the price was right but I now regret the purchase. I had planned to use it during summer camping but we got snowed in without power this winter and I had to put it to use. It has two 'dials' for the burners, but, neither of these work on anything but the highest - no matter where you put it, it automatically goes to the highest setting and it wastes an enormous amount of fuel. I am very disappointed because I trusted the Coleman brand, but now, I'm stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bluerider

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to replace
customer_reviews.text: My old one but I couldn’t get it to work. Not sure if Coleman is going downhill, or I just had bad luck. Test it before you head out camping in case you have the same issues.
customer_reviews.author: Poppins

customer_reviews.title: Poor Chinese quality build
customer_reviews.text: Like others that left reviews, I received a stove with a bad rivet. The left side was missing the rivet so the left support was not attached to the top cover. I am so happy that I bought it through Amazon. The return was painless since I could drop it off at a local Kohls. I ended up buying an old used stove and I took it apart and refurbished it because all the new Coleman stuff is made in China. Our Coleman tent is good but I don't think this Coleman stove is good.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald consumer

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, worked for ten minutes then no gas reaches ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, worked for ten minutes then no gas reaches the valves. No working on a fishing trip. Glad we brought the old standby multi fuel or wed have been cooking over the fire in the rain. Added 5.24.18 - Contacted Coleman and they are sending a new regulator to correct the issue.
customer_reviews.author: km

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable for the price
customer_reviews.text: Typical camp stove, flimsy sheet metal construction but as expected. Mine arrived damaged from the factory, the burners were bent to about 35 degrees or so in different directions. I was able to bend it all back in place with minimal effort. The main reason for the 4 star review, aside from built quality, is the burner adjustment knobs. They're completely useless. The knobs have about 270 degrees of movement, but only the first 5 degrees do anything. The burner is either full blast or ready to go out with a hair of movement on the knob. The burner "adjustment" knobs are completely useless, consider them binary(off/on)
customer_reviews.author: Liquid

customer_reviews.title: What Not to Love about a Coleman Camping Stove
customer_reviews.text: Camping lunches are commonly sandwiches and dinners are skewered over the campfire. But, breakfast? That's when you need some coffee and some substantial food to propel you into the day. That's where this little stove shines. Pot of water for your french press coffee? Check. Two skillet omelette station couple with pre-cracked eggs and pre-cooked meat and veggies? You're cooking in just a couple minutes. I don't want to build a fire in the morning. Not until I have some coffee in me. We love our little Coleman Camp Stove!
customer_reviews.author: chadrico

customer_reviews.title: It's great for boiling water
customer_reviews.text: The burners are either off or full blast. It's great for boiling water, but horrible for trying to cook any real food.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: A MUST if you live in California!
customer_reviews.text: The first stove i ordered was seriously defective. The burned were mounted severely crooked. I scheduled for a replacement and the second one that came was perfect. I used it in the last two power outages in North California. I cooked anything from burgers to eggs, from pasta to noodles. Tea, coffee. It worked like a charm. Pretty safe to use. Good output from a single coleman propane small tank. Highly recommend, BUT buy ahead of time, open, make sure the burners are well mounted. It seems a common issue from other reviews. But a replacement is very easy to do, just save the boxes it comes until you checked.
customer_reviews.author: Elisa HorrellTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed twice! Assembly Extremely Poor/Damaged before packaging!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed!! Thin metal. Who ever is assembling this product doesn’t know what they’re doing! Terrible assembly & damaged!!! 1st one I got looked better than this 2nd one. Both returned! I have pictures to show you. Packaging:=Good. Outside, brown box and the Coleman box were not crushed or bent. Main Problem:=Assembly Extremely Poor and Damaged before packaging!!!
customer_reviews.author: Big Bear

customer_reviews.title: One burner got wet, no longer works
customer_reviews.text: One side of the burner got a bit wet when water boiled over. It has never worked after that, so essentially I paid for half of a stove. Use this as a cautionary tale! Don't get the burners wet.
customer_reviews.author: eee

customer_reviews.title: Field test review
customer_reviews.text: This camping stove is a good value for the money. There are no fancy bells or whistles on this model. One burner was slightly bent, but I bent it back by just fine. It is lightweight and packs easily, the case is durable, and is a reliable tool. The burner flame was pretty much invisible but the heat adjusts easily. On a 3 day excursion we were cooking twice a day for 7 people and we only used around 22oz of propane. If your looking for a simple stove that will last a long time with proper care then this is a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben Von Hammerstein

customer_reviews.title: Coleman keeps making solid products
customer_reviews.text: I'm a long time user of Coleman products, and have two of these Classic stoves. The one I just purchased is a bit different from the one I bought three years ago, but they are both of good quality. The reviews here were surprisingly harsh, many comments about the valves not providing enough control, and over all poor quality in materials and workmanship. This is not my experience, the valves on my new one have finer control than the older one, and the quality seems just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ephi82

customer_reviews.title: Well, it's Coleman ~ *yay Coleman*
customer_reviews.text: Second Coleman stove in 40 years. First can still be used, though stand has seen better days. So, The Classic is still available! Every camping trip, every power outage (near window cracked open always), and needed a new stove for upcoming storm season because, well, the older one is better saved for campgrounds. If using indoors, make sure to have a window cracked a bit open, even in hurricane events (well, cracked windows [2 only] relieve pressure). Love my Coleman stove!
customer_reviews.author: cherrib

customer_reviews.title: Good stove. Some quirks.
customer_reviews.text: Good stove. Made breakfast and boiled water for coffee easily. The burners seem pretty efficent. Ran both burners for several minutes and the little propane tank still felt full. Easy to assemble and store. The only downside is the slats on the grate for the cookware to sit on is way too wide. I'll be welding some additional cross bars so I can use smaller pots without fear of them tipping. On the plus side, the water I spilled into the burner seemed to quickly dissipate after running non-lit propane through it.
customer_reviews.author: rescue5150

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this because the propane stove in my old old popup camper was not really very useable. The stove was easy to set up and did a great good cooking the bacon and eggs right out of the box the first morning at camp. Burners are more powerful than the campers tired stove. Set up was easy and it packs up small. The only thing I really dont care a lot for is the need for those 1pound cans of propane that are becoming expensive. I think Im going to get a long hose to let me run it and my grill from the trailer's 20lb tank for next season, to solve that one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Coleman Stove
customer_reviews.text: I've been pretty faithful to the Coleman brand for many years, but this stove was honestly disappointing. It works like it should and it would look really nice if it wasn't put together haphazardly. It is essentially bent sheet metal like most of these stoves, but the bends are not very precise, resulting in a terrible overall fit. I have a nice sharp edge where it should sit flush to the side of the stove, and the burners are bent...
customer_reviews.author: Chaotic

customer_reviews.title: Easy, long lasting, convenient
customer_reviews.text: A big must have for camping. My dad has had his for 30 years. Still works. I been borrowing one that's atleast 10 years old, still works. I just bought my own, looking forward to camping out with this bad boy and maybe giving it to my son. Makes boiling water so easy, cooking full on meals in normal kitchen pans a breeze. I've impressed multiple people with what this stove has cooked. Also great for hurricane season. (I'm in Florida)
customer_reviews.author: David Mckee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Camp Stove
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect camp stove for people who do not want to cook all their meals over a raging freaking fire while some people poke sticks and poison ivy and trash in the flames, then fart and then wonder where their dinner comes from... The two burners offer variety in cooking/heating, as long as one uses the appropriate pots. Also, there is a "2-burner non-stick camp griddle" which perfectly fits this stove, and is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Jammer

customer_reviews.title: Nice stove
customer_reviews.text: Nice, reasonably priced camping stove. Seems very well built, sturdy, and made of metal, not plastic. Only think I do not like are the knobs. They are cheap feeling and you have to turn it multiple revolutions to get it to full burner power. I often forget how many turns I've gone and accidentally turn the burner off, when I'm just trying to lower it, and have to relight the grill. There is no push button lighter, you will need a camp lighter with long handle. Overall, this is still a great value and I'm sure will last years. The wind blocking panels have a nice spring loaded tensioner to hold them in place.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Our best camping investment yet
customer_reviews.text: Right now, fires aren't allowed at any campsites or dispersed camping in our area due to wildfires and ranger cutbacks. This is a great way to get food prepared. The output is good and cooks food relatively quickly (though probably a bit longer than a fire). It is pretty compact so you'll need either a griddle or two smaller pans if you want to use both burners. I've been using a 10" cast iron and it's too big, I have to constantly rotate the cast iron to make sure the entire thing is getting heat underneath. It's also a little heavy but not too bad. Very easy to wipe down, set up and put away.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly and easy to travel with
customer_reviews.text: Great product - bought it for my daughters JROTC National Raider competition. All the parents set up tents for two days while the kids compete. Temps were 25-30 degrees and inky warmed up to 40s during the day. But we were able to heat up soup, hot chocolate, coffee, etc and keep everyone satisfied. It heated up quickly and stores neatly, compactly- easy to travel with. Def would buy again or recommend to others
customer_reviews.author: ael

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy effective camping stove, could use a better handle
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camping stove, the burners are decently strong but do burn through a decent amount of gas too. The windshield also doubles as a heat shield. Feels pretty sturdy, except for the exposed unmarked knobs. The new handle design is much less ergonomic than the older versions, opting for a recessed handle rather than a folding wire handle that allows you to grip with your entire fist.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Xu

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this stove to replace worn out Coleman Powerhouse liquid fuel stove. At time of this purchase I believed in the Coleman quality. Upon opening the box I found the right side "wind guard" hinge broken off. Hinges holding lid are weak & wobbly; lid will not stay upright unless both left & right wind guards are used. Right control knob was loose, barely on. Propane easy to install; was able to light it after I tightened the control knob. Materials used throughout this stove appear to be flimsy, not made for a long useful life. If I had actually seen this item in a store I wouldn't have purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: WhoMe?

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to our camping gear
customer_reviews.text: This was my husband's father's day present this year, and it has been out on two camping trips this summer. It's great for making coffee, getting breakfast made without starting a campfire, and making some fancier camp foods. It's been a lifesaver on rainy days when we couldn't get a good fire going. The temperature control is fine if you can judge by the look of the flame and then adjust as needed while cooking. We use this with our 10" cast iron pan, an aluminum tea kettle (for boiling water for coffee/tea/etc), and a small non-stick pan (for eggs) and it has performed well for us.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Rohrer

customer_reviews.title: Factory Assembly is so poor the whole thing is TRASH.
customer_reviews.text: Nope. Bought this in the spring to go camping this summer. Finally unpacked it (after the return window closed) and the stove is assembled so poorly the stove's grey plate is misaligned and hanging over to the left, overhanging the stove, causing the whole thing to not open/close well - at all. One of burner connectors is also assembled incorrectly (from the factory) so the burner screw piece is crooked. It's so crooked I would imagine there could be a propane leak before the burner connectors. The whole thing is trash. And I am leaving for camping tommorrow. My son will get to enjoy a cold dinner. *Grumpy face*
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I waited to post a review until we had used this a few times. Let me tell you... it's the best propane grill we could've asked for. Having the two burners with ample space for two large saucepans is phenomenal. It packs up so nice as well (I did not spring for the case), is easy to clean and is perfect for pop up grill sessions or festival/camping. Definitely reccomend!
customer_reviews.author: Tay C.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this grill for our camping trip as we have statewide fire bans. My husband was able to set it up very quickly. The temperature gauges are a little tricky to figure out at first, but he got a hang of it. It outputs good heat. We used a smaller grate for the top so we could grill hotdogs easily, which we took for our home BBQ grill. It does not come with propane though and we had to go around to several stores to find them as they are selling out. It’s lightweight too. Worth the price in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Best stove for the price but could be better
customer_reviews.text: I think this is the best stove you can get for the price...having said that, it would be nice to have it's own lighter but I keep one under the grill so that's no problem. The biggest complaint about this stove is the controls are really tricky in that they don't stay where you adjust them...they spring back a little bit so it's hard to control the flame. When you are using a typical camp cookware set (they aren't very thick because of weight savings) you really need to be able to fine tune the flame and this makes it difficult.
customer_reviews.author: John Naughton

customer_reviews.title: reliable stove
customer_reviews.text: Took a moment to put the stove together but I was able to use it this weekend while camping and I must say its a fast heat even with the 1lb bottle I used it still put out great heat to boil some water. Would recommend if anyone is looking for a somewhat light weight I am sure a backpack one out be much lighter but well worth the price, I saw some in local retail stores and they were asking the same or even more as far as price. Good stove all in all.
customer_reviews.author: LethalDose

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I figured with all the chaos right now I should have something to cook my toilet paper on if the power goes down. This will be perfect to cook small meals if need be.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Its a stove
customer_reviews.text: My parents have had the same coleman propane stove for as long as i can remember...atleast 20 yrs. We decided to quite borrowing and get our own. It does the job. You cant control the tank output itself, which i didnt like, and the burners nobs were very different. They are normal nobs but 1 of the burners wont go on low or it goes out, you have to turn it atleast half way to start the flame, kinda scary. We used it for two 1 week long trips and like i said it did the job just feel like it wasnt made as well.
customer_reviews.author: Crhystal

customer_reviews.title: Must have for Emergency Scenarios and leisure camping
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it right after Hurricane Maria hit Puerto Rico and power outages made my electric stove useless. Very convenient size and weight; can easily transport it to any location. Inexpensive 2 burner stove and propane tanks easily accessible; in addition purchased adapter in order to use bigger propane tanks as needed. Dislikes: 1. Temperature knobs are sensitive and sometimes difficult to select low flame / temperature. 2. The space between the aluminium grill is two wide some small pots and specially for small stove top coffee makers / percolators. Overall recommend to purchase at least one for emergency purposes if you normally use an electric stove; and very convenient to transport it to any site.
customer_reviews.author: David Laboy

customer_reviews.title: Great burner, control knobs are potential weaknesses.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great dual burner, everything works well! Why the 4 starts then!? The control knobs, they need to be recessed, or have the metal frame extend around them. They're weak plastic knobs, and it seems they would crack, or break off easily if you're not careful while transporting, or loading it in and out of the truck.
customer_reviews.author: smee

customer_reviews.title: California cooking
customer_reviews.text: I use a single burner bottle mount stove and balancing things on top just got too old in the last power outage. This is a much better and safer choice for managing pots and pans. So, this is obviously a basic camp stove and it works great and is priced right. It's easy to light and is quiet (especially compared to my old Primus single-burner). It's light and folds up easily. Very competent basic stove, I like it a lot and is a must if you have power outages (like California's power shutoffs). This classic Coleman stove does well.
customer_reviews.author: SP3204

customer_reviews.title: Sweet
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a white gas Coleman that was hard to start, especially in the winter. I cook beans and potatoes outside in the Summer, to keep the heat and humidity out of the house. The propane bottles are not expensive and one will last 5 hours on low while cooking Pinto beans. This unit is thin and lite and designed well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: How do you like your heat?  Off, hot, or absurdly hot?
customer_reviews.text: You really want to love this stove. It's a Coleman, so it's neither pretentious nor fragile. BUT, as other reviews state, the temperature control on this model is horrible. There is very little flow regulation, so the options are either low (hot), or high (re-entry hot), and the adjustment between the two temps is (for my grill) about a 5 degree difference in turn. Your steaks will be raw on the inside and scorched on the outside. This will be replaced by another model that has better temperature control.
customer_reviews.author: Nomadic

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camping stove for a small group
customer_reviews.text: Used it with propane can and had good experience so far and I recommend this product. Quick to assemble (a minute or so), blocks the wind, stable, compact, light, sturdy and strong. The knobs, including the temperature control and on off doesn't have any feedback, if there is no flame or until it's lit up, you don't what's the position of the flow control knob, which makes it a bit risky, however, that risk becomes low when used only outdoors, that's risk becomes low when used outdoor.
customer_reviews.author: ramm

customer_reviews.title: Good Stove; Uber-Sensitive Dials
customer_reviews.text: Happy with purchase. Easy to set up and to clean. Wind guard definitely helpful. Note: Flame adjuster dials are VERY SENSITIVE. I had a difficult time keeping a low flame because I'd get it to the right level, then remove my fingers and in doing so, the dial would ziiiiiiiiiiiip to the left or right, blasting the flame or turning it totally off. It would be nice if the dial was either less sensitive or had pre-set stopping points that you could click to. Used two (16oz) propane cylinders for a six-day trip, cooking three times per day.
customer_reviews.author: Miz Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Coleman stoves have been a workhorse for camping for decades. I expect them to be reliable, but slightly underperform - especially at low heat settings. This stove address that issue. Heat settings can be finally adjusted before the flame goes out. Also, this model is sleeker, and more portable than prior versions I've used.. Even has an awesome recessed hole to use as a carry handle to grab it out of the bin or whatever. Super happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Z

customer_reviews.title: Terrifying eruption of flames from all holes!!
customer_reviews.text: My original review said "No need to waste money on a more expensive stove when this one does the trick!" It has served me well, using it nearly every day for almost a year but NOW it has exploded into flames 5-10 times. This was NOT due to user error. (When I screw in the canister the knobs are OFF and I screw the arm in FIRST as tightly as I can. And it literally erupts in flames out of every hole. TERRIFYING!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Hilary Hannah Neilson

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and easy for cooking.
customer_reviews.text: Convenient and compact. Had no issues cooking eggs and sausage. I camped for years using a fire pit for all my cooking; this stove made cooking a lot easier now that my family is getting bigger. The sheet metal is a bit flimsy but for the value, it does exactly it's function. It would be nice to have more fine tuned temperature control; it seems to be on high or low with no in between.
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: Followed what others had said
customer_reviews.text: Followed the information about cleaning the valves before the initial use. It works great and everything is a nice fit. Having an old white gas model that is over 60 years old and comparing that to this one I can see what people are talking about when then say that it is just not the same standard. It is good quality for what you can buy now but is not the Coleman of old.
customer_reviews.author: Diane K. Borden

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a chance to use it yet, but size of it is perfect. Easy to haul around, easy access for cleaning and a perfect size for camping with a small family. I'm going camping very soon, I'll update this once I get a chance to fully immerse my self this guy. Update: This thing is awesome. Just used to camp with the family and boy does it get the job done. Easy to use and easy to wipe down. I stand by what I said earlier. The only thing I need to get with it is a table.
customer_reviews.author: Gio

customer_reviews.title: Your parents owned one for a good reason, because it works.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing complicated here, just a timeless design that forsakes glamour for function. You won't win any "ooohs" or "ahhhhs" from your "glamping" friends, but at least your cooker will outlast you and will work everytime you need it. This takes up very little space, and is big enough to fit a dutch oven and a fry pan next to each other. Puts out enough heat to take a cold stew to a rolling boil in less than 10 minutes on a windy 45 degree day.
customer_reviews.author: Martoune

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded luxury
customer_reviews.text: After my old dual-fuel Coleman liquid stove died (while camping of course), I wanted something simpler and more reliable. This stove is just that. It's a lot easier to deal with and get up and cooking compared to the liquid fuel stoves. I love it and look forward to using this one. Goodbye old, hello new!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Carol

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like this but there are some things that made me ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this but there are some things that made me give it a low score. I took it out for the first time this weekend and after opening and closing about 2 times, the left corner of the grill came detached from the frame. Now when I open the top it rubs against the the detached piece. Also the I'm not sure if it was the wind or not but the burner on the right kept going out while I had no problems with the left.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Turn knob around 2x to light!!!
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used this stove to cook yet but before you send yours back bc you think it doesn’t work and before trying to dismantle valves to get it to work...know that the knobs on this stove are not like your home kitchen stove knobs that go around 360 1x. You have to turn these knobs at least 540 to get enough gas coming out (you’ll hear it) so that you can actually light it.
customer_reviews.author: Sean P Dodds

customer_reviews.title: Just like having a stove at home!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time using a stove when tent camping. We loved this two-burner stove. Used very little propane- one small can lasted all week even with both burners going at least daily. It's super light weight and easy to clean. It worked out very well.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mcleod

customer_reviews.title: lifesaver for hurricane season
customer_reviews.text: Lifesaver for hurricane. I primarily got this camping stove for the purpose of camping. However while in Louisiana we experience power outage for days due to hurricane Laura. Guess who still gets hot breakfast with coffee every morning, yep this guy.
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel

customer_reviews.title: Back up against power going down
customer_reviews.text: When your state has power going out because of the power company that said they don't want their power line to cause any fires. This would come in handy for this reason. And when earthquake hits and power goes down. Always be ready for these problems.
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: My last one was a coleman that used petrol gas as fuel. While it was convenient, keeping the pressure in the tank was problematic and eventually, the tank gave out and I could not maintain pressure. Bought this one and wished I had bought it years ago, easy to setup, clean and more compact than my old one. Pop in a propane tank and you are ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Whisperer

customer_reviews.title: No product inspection
customer_reviews.text: Just received this stove and it is quite evident that there wasn't ANY Quality Control. The left burner won't come off and just spins when I try to remove it. The bottom aluminum drip plate wasn't even completely inserted. I had always trusted Coleman in the past, although now, it seems they are working haphazardly just to get their product to the market. Very disappointed! I'm hoping that the burners will work.
customer_reviews.author: Andy B

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a 40+ year old Coleman stove. Used it all weekend on a camping trip and it was perfect. Pay attention when you light it...it seems like you have to turn it to a fairly open setting, and the flames are barely perceptible when it does light. Cooked 4 full meals on it and boiled several pots of water. It was great - as easy to use as my home stove. It also seemed WAY more efficient than our old stove. We had a used canister, used it all weekend and still have gas left. Should have replaced that old stove sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Junker

customer_reviews.title: Great for emergency backup.
customer_reviews.text: Bought on black Friday deal, so great price. Works perfect. Plenty of size for larger skillets, or a large griddle. We mainly bought for our hurricane supply box, as we live in a target area. The small propane canisters are sold all over, and if you watch walmart they have decent price on them. Its also adaptable to a supply hose and a larger propane tank, which in long run is much better bargain. Only drawback to this unit is it does not have a built in starter. Must use a match or lighter. I put one in the grill when I closed it up so it's there when we need it.
customer_reviews.author: SEA 3

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged and not the quality I expect from Coleman
customer_reviews.text: Received the Coleman propane stove quickly but was very disappointed in the lack of quality control. The stove was dented and the place to screw In the connector for the propane was so off center that the metal had to be cut and then filed down for safety. Very cheaply made and not up to what I expected from Coleman. We were leaving to go camping too soon to return the stove and reorder especially since there was no guarantee that it would arrive Undamaged. Ultimately we were able to fix the issues and it did work but did not live up to the Coleman brand.
customer_reviews.author: MBW

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: Great product, can't beat the price. Used it once so far on a camping trip. Had both burner going at the same time, one to boil an 8in pot of water and the other to heat up a 10in skillet to make breakfast. Worked great. Setup and cleanup is a breeze. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: PrimeShopper

customer_reviews.title: Great Camp Stove
customer_reviews.text: This stove is light weight, and very portable. It does the job as well as any stove on the market, and these stoves tend to last a long time. I have another one just like this one, that was purchased over 40 years ago, and it still works as well as the day it was purchased. I only bought this one so we would have 4 burners to cook with to allow for the larger family on camping trips. This camp stove is one you will be glad you purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Menimeth

customer_reviews.title: Works well once you've got it lit and adjusted, but that takes some work.
customer_reviews.text: As others have noted, there's about 2 degrees of knob rotation that actually affect the flame. There's about 88 degrees of jet engine, and then the tiniest bit that gets it back to a reasonable cooking range, and then "poof" its out. If you already have a hot griddle on top, your best bet is to just let it leak a ton of gas and relight itself from the other burner with a nice little explosion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should! Great little stove
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant at best about my purchase after reading reviews saying its adjustment knobs were fickle. Upon unboxing, I attempted to take the knobs off. I unscrewed them but they did not seem to want to come off. I decided to just try it as it was. Glad I did too. The adjustment knobs seemed to work great, even for fine adjustment. I've included two photos from each end of the adjustment spectrum. I dont know if it was a one off thing, but mine was in great condition and worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Adam H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size stove for casual camping!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great addition to our camping gear! In the daytime the burners can be tough to tell if they're lit if you don't pay attention when you light it. You might hear the gas and feel heat but that doesn't mean the burner is lit. Or maybe we're idiots. Regardless, it's propane and fire so be careful. I love the carrying handle although the edge is a bit sharp but I guess I'm being picky again. Set up and take down is easy. We cooked eggs, chili, and paninis and everything came out great. The side panels are decent enough protection from wind although you can use bigger pots/pans if you don't use them.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Depew

customer_reviews.title: Came Broken
customer_reviews.text: Super sad that when this arrived the metal on the inside was already bent. Thought maybe I could get over it but then the stove itself wouldn't light. Had to return it since it didn't work and had to push back my camping trip a few days until I could get one that worked.
customer_reviews.author: Jenine G.

customer_reviews.title: Received defective product. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: This item was a Christmas gift. When I opened it to get ready for my camping trip for the summer I found that it was defective. The top cover was bent on a corner so it will not close all the way and the latch will spring open.I got it as a gift and did not open until way past the return policy to notice the defect so I’m stuck with a broken camp stove. Very disappointed I was looking forward to this item. Please contact me if there is any chance for a exchange. I do not want a refund I want a functioning product. Thank you. Shellydouro@live.com
customer_reviews.author: christy l douro

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to adjust flame
customer_reviews.text: I know about the the over greased valve stem, I've tried that. It went well for a while, then the same trouble came back. I think this is a quality control issue. My friend has the same stove. The valve in his stove takes almost two full turns to fully open, and is very easy to reduce the flame to simmer. He never needed to know about the de-greasing fix. Mine? About 1/8 of a turn and it's at full blast. It's very annoying when I'm just trying to cook an egg.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: A bit pricey for the quality
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn’t mind paying $25-$50 but I think $70 or more is a bit outrageous for a little mini propane stove. It works great and all but only has the 2 burners and the build feels too cheap to justify the price. That said... I use it regularly enough to justify the price. I tailgate when I snowboard each weekend and also for camping in the summer. I still like the stove, just wish the price was less
customer_reviews.author: Dildo Schwaggins

customer_reviews.title: Classic cooker for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: This was absolutely perfect for what I needed it for. The burners are very efficient and give you a nice blue flame. One 16.4oz canister cooked two pounds of sausage, a pound of bacon, enough fried potatoes for several adults, and two pots of coffee. I used a 12" and a 10" pan simultaneously. Loved this thing. It's well built and super easy to use. Can't wait to use it again.
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: It works great
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly, I was able to control the flame with no issues. Cooked up some burgers on one burner and frying some eggs and bacon on the other burner. For the price, I'm pleased with the performance
customer_reviews.author: SPENCERWASHERE

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, reliable source of heat/portable stove for camping
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for my dad for Christmas. He needed one because we go camping all the time. This makes a great portable camp stove to make food whilst out in the wilderness. It’s pretty heavy so it takes part of the portability out of it but for all it does, it’s a great price and deal. It’s cheaper on amazon than any store to purchase and it offers a lot of stuff that it can do.
customer_reviews.author: SavageRandy

customer_reviews.title: Like the old days at the beach
customer_reviews.text: My family of 9 had one for the beach in the 70's and I had to send it to my girlfriend in PR after the Hurricane... There is no beating the quality and workmanship of Coleman on this unit... The two burners work great and with the use of the 4 ft hose adapter for a 20 lb I can have the option fr longer cooking time and the size of tank .. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Rocks In Motion

customer_reviews.title: Very happy I bought one of these for camping
customer_reviews.text: Very happy I bought one of these for camping. Super quick and easy to set up/ take down and clean. Very simple to use. It did take a few tries for me to get it lit the first couple times because you have to have the gas turned on the very least amount it can be, literally only turn the knob one millimeter or too much gas will come out and you will not be able to light it. The flame and heat is very strong, have a good quality pot/pan so you don't scorch your food or the bottom of your pan. I would recommend this stove
customer_reviews.author: Bxoxo

customer_reviews.title: Best basic camp stove for portable tailgating
customer_reviews.text: Very predictable for use, and surprised how well the gas controls work, could regulate flame to very low setting without blowout. We had a large pot of chili cooking then warming. Family members very happy with this product, better than expected. It is a simple unit compared to others/upgrades but does everything/the basics well. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: road_warrior

customer_reviews.title: Maybe other brands are better built
customer_reviews.text: Coleman is what most think of as the best for outdoor products. In this case I think they can do better. The grill lid not square when closed and the metal is getting thinner compared to older models. Hinges on the cover are super cheap, and feel like they will break after a good long year of use. Overall quality of coleman products I have brought they seem to be going cheaper and cheaper on how its built. Sad to say maybe check other brands that are better built. Will update after our trip this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Huelsman

customer_reviews.title: As advertised..
customer_reviews.text: I like the portable stove. Very lightweight as advertised and easy to control heat. The purchase was for camping trips as we wanted to upgrade from coil grill. Great for cooking rice, stews, anything you have to boil. In order to grill u must buy the cast iron grill piece or griddle. I think I will upgrade to one that has both for next year because I found tht when grilling with the attachment piece it only gets hot where the burners are. The middle of the grill does not get enough heat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice stove but packaging needs help
customer_reviews.text: It took me 3 attempts to get a stove that wasn’t damaged. First 2 were scratched, dented and burners were bent. They need to improve the packaging for shipping. I wouldn’t recommend buying if you need it NOW. Seems like a nice stove. I haven’t cooked in it yet but it did start right up with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Linda K.

customer_reviews.title: Simple Portable Light Weight Cook Stove
customer_reviews.text: Have owned Coleman Products for years and this one has the quality and easy setup to get cooking right away. It is lighter than our first Coleman gas stove which lasted over 25 years. Propane is a big plus over the gas. Easy to light and a nice small 2 burner unit to store. We bought for use when power goes off to cook on the exterior patio.
customer_reviews.author: Blinky Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Powerful burner, easy setup. We bought this stove to take with us for extended camping trips and so far have been very happy. With two burners, you can quickly make all your meals in a jiffy. We were able to boil 2 quarts of water in about 7-8 minutes for coffee for everyone in the morning with no trouble. You do need your own lighter/match to ignite the stove. My only caveat is I wish it had a handle for easier carrying.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Safe and easy
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple propane-fueled 2-burner stove that is great for car camping. It will boil water quickly. It's lightweight, easy to assemble, and simple to use. The only downside of this stove is the lack of labeling on the burner valves. When adjusting the flame, it's difficult to tell which way to turn the valve to adjust the gas flow without trial-and-error.
customer_reviews.author: K. M. Viita

customer_reviews.title: Does Someone Do It Better?
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a similar stove that went wherever missing socks go. As always, it's a Coleman so it works. Update: so actually just needs this stove for the first time during a recent power outage. I liked everything about it except for one thing; the flame controls didn't hold well on a lower setting. The flame was a bit more than I actually needed and there was no way I could turn it down and have it stay there. Having said that, it is still a very nice stove and served us well. Be sure and buy the propane bottles ahead of needing them as they were almost impossible to buy when the power went out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Use this all the time
customer_reviews.text: Could not be any happy. I did not have any trouble with temperature control like some other reviews had mentioned. It is easy to breakdown and setup, gets out quickly, and cooks my food perfectly everytime. Also love that is such a fair price point. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cooks very well!
customer_reviews.text: I have been car-camping and this stove is amazing. It cooks everything from bacon to burgers to toast perfectly. It is very easy to light and set temp. Super easy to use and cooks what I need!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Helped out huge during a power fialure.  Not exactly built like a tank, but it did the job!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon ran a sale on these and I crabbed on as a "what the heck...". Picked up two bottles of propane and threw the whole mess in the closet. With the last snow storm, we lost power for 4 days. This stove was a life saver for breakfast. We had a generator to run the 110 stuff, but not the stove, so this was a blessing. Adjustment knobs can be fincky - either on full blast or off. Also, a spark ignitor would have been nice (has to be lit with matches). That said, it boiled water quickly and was able to cook eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Love this stove. A friend had brought theirs on a shared camping trip, so I knew I wanted one. It works great, doesn't use much propane, and is easy to transport. I think it's supposed to come with it's own lighter, but we brought a long bbq lighter since that's easier and safer than letting propane gas get everywhere. Perfect for our little van camper (but make sure you only use it outside!!)
customer_reviews.author: Hypatia

customer_reviews.title: A Classic!!!
customer_reviews.text: These stoves are nostalgic for me because it reminds me of camping in the Boy Scouts. These old Coleman stoves are great: tried and true. The propane tanks are always available in the US. And they just work for car camping. Not the lightest. One thing! How can they not add an ignitor to the old design? It would make things so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel B.

customer_reviews.title: Not your grandfather's Coleman stove but safer and easier to use... Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Very consistent and relatively easy to prepare for cooking. Doesn't put out the BTUs of the old white gas "pump-up" stoves but it's enough to fry a 10" skillet full of French fries. I'll retire my gasoline stove for the convenience of propane.i
customer_reviews.author: G-Dub

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy
customer_reviews.text: I am so impressed with this stove. It puts an outstanding amount of heat out on high (better than my apartment old gas stove). Well designed. This will last a long time. Also one small tank of gas lasts forever! One complaint. The detachable gas tube doesn't store inside tight. It can rattle in transit fixable with a large rubber band
customer_reviews.author: EngineerDave

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Package came on time, but the quality of the products is terrible. Both burners look like flying saucers - extremely crooked. I would not even try to use the product. Will return it!
customer_reviews.author: Al M. Davenport

customer_reviews.title: 100% worth the buy
customer_reviews.text: This stove is perfect for camping! My husband typically enjoys using a tripod to cook meals over the fire however it sometimes takes so long to cook meals... especially when you’ve got 3 antsy kids! This heated up food SO quickly we were very impressed! I’m really glad we bought this because it made mealtime that much easier camping.
customer_reviews.author: MrsVH

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic stove
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to go camping with and was definitely not disappointed. Food cooked fabulous and packing up and storing away was a cinch. This is so light for carrying around and easy to set up. My only gripe is that it's difficult to see the flames from the burner when in direct sunlight, but this does not deter from cooking food. Overall, excellent product and totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Cousin Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Buy it for camping
customer_reviews.text: We had/still have our old grill on one side/burner on the other side coleman propane cook top but this is awesome. We bought a propane tower so we can run multi propane devices off of one 5 gallon tank and now we have 3 burners to cook while camping. This heats up quickly, stores fairly flat and will be a go to on camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This stove was awesome! We always cooked over our camp fire but this time we wanted to upgrade! This 2 burner stove got the job done quickly, and beautifully. Paired with a griddle or mess kit, everything cooked wonderfully. We were on a 4 day camping trip and didnt even use a full bottle! Impressed! Clean up afterwards is also a breeze! I love how it just shines right back up! Very portable! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mandii McMillan

customer_reviews.title: Replaced 30+ year old coleman
customer_reviews.text: Essentially replaced a similar model purchased 30+ years ago. Worked great last week. My only complaint is the two burner griddle that fit inside the other coleman does not fit inside this one - the lid is not as deep and won't close. The griddle does work great on the burners though so will just store elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: LAF

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver...
customer_reviews.text: Used this item in the aftermath of Hurricanes Irma & Maria. Excellent product of good quality. Easy to clean and put away after using. The burner provides consistent heat while cooking. You can use indoor and outdoor. However, if it's windy outside the gas goes by quicker. It last longer in windless conditions. The items was just as described. Perfect for camping and/or disaster relief. I definitely recommend this item. Truly a lifesaver.
customer_reviews.author: Pet Trainer

customer_reviews.title: This is light and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Really loved this! It was easy to clean and set up. I like that it is compact too. We took this camping but I plan to use in the backyard when I need to cook smelly fish! haha!
customer_reviews.author: yvette

customer_reviews.title: Nice little stove.
customer_reviews.text: As a senior, I don't camp much these days. I bought this stove primarily for the occasional yard party and as a backup in case of power outages. This is a good little stove that seems to be well made. Both sides burn clean and uniformly. Overall this is alot of utility at a very reasonable price. With a little TLC, this product should last a good long time.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Davis

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction and design, needs better flame regulation.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this a couple of times now. It's easy to set up and clean and it's decent at blocking drafts so it cooks quickly. I give it four stars because it lacks any means to level it. Having screw type adjustable feet would have been great. Also, the pressure control from the gas wasn't quite what I was hoping for. I get better flame control with my day-pack, single burner Ozark Trail stove than I do with this one. I kept having to fiddle with it to get to where I could cook my eggs without scorching them.
customer_reviews.author: CharlesTop Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: Great stove. Easy to use. But.
customer_reviews.text: For car camping, this stove was great. Easy to use and clean. We'd only used ultra light backpacking stoves before. The easy availability of propane, the dual burners, the simple design made this stove a pleasure to work with. We used it for breakfast and dinner for 6 weeks of camping. The next year we used it for breakfast and dinner for eight weeks. At the very end of our trip it stopped working completely and we don’t know why. Coleman was not helpful. Now we have a stove that used to work.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Millstone

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product!
customer_reviews.text: As with the Coleman name, this camp stove excelled in all aspects of performance. I've used it in all recent power shutdowns in Northern California and it performed flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: cjs

customer_reviews.title: Classic. Solid. Effective. Cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Just like the ones from 30 years ago. Works wonderfully. Cooked 3-meals a day for a camp of 9 people recently and never was disappointed. Fits a 10" cast iron skillet and a small pot simultaneously. Can't really go wrong with the classic Coleman stove.
customer_reviews.author: The Hefley-Beck Collective

customer_reviews.title: Best camp stove, don’t waste over 100$ on others
customer_reviews.text: Don’t let bad reviews deter you from the Coleman stove. Coleman has been in business for years making quality products that they stand behind. A lot of the negative reviews I read talk about poor gas control but that is the case with ANY camp stove and much of it is due to variations in altitude, temperature, and humidity. You need to become familiar with it before cooking like a pro, so just give it a few tries before saying it sucks. Also cooking with cast iron is a great way to improve even temperature dispersal across your pan. Biggest pros: low cost, great customer support, and a quality long lasting product.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Schroeder

product_meta.title: Coleman Gas Camping Stove | Classic Propane Stove, 2 Burner
product_meta.description:
Cook breakfast, lunch, and dinner on a dependable stove that packs up easily with the Coleman Classic Propane Gas Camping Stove. The 2 burners put out 20,000 total BTUs of grilling power and are shielded from the wind by adjustable wind-blocking panels. Rest assured, your stove will perform consistently even in extreme conditions thanks to the pressure regulator.

AMAZON.COM
About Coleman More than 100 years ago, a young man with an entrepreneurial spirit and a better idea began manufacturing lanterns in Wichita, Kansas. His name was W.C. Coleman, and the company he founded would change life in America. A man plagued with such poor vision he sometimes had to ask classmates to read aloud to him, Coleman saw a brilliant light in 1900 in a drugstore window that stopped him in his tracks. He inquired about the light inside and discovered he was able to read even the small print on a medicine bottle by the illumination. The lamps had mantles, not wicks, and were fueled by gasoline under pressure instead of coal oil. Soon afterward, Coleman started a lighting service that offered a "no light, no pay" clause--a big step forward for merchants who were burned by inferior products that rarely worked--and drew substantial interest from businesses that wanted to keep their lights on after dark. In the ensuing years, Coleman expanded its product line well beyond lanterns. The company's current catalog is thick with products that make spending time outdoors a pleasure. There are coolers that keep food and drinks cold for days on end, comfortable airbeds that won't deflate during the night, a complete line of LED lights that last for years, powerful portable grills that cook with an authentic open-grill flame, and much, much more. Coleman has truly fashioned much of our outdoor camping experience, and expects to do so for generations to come.
feature_bullets: Cooking power: Up to 20,000 total BTUs
2 adjustable burners: For precise temperature control
Wind-blocking panels: Shield burners from wind
Pressure regulator: Pressure-control technology for consistent performance, even in extreme conditions
Runtime: Up to 1 hour on high on one 16.4 ounce propane cylinder (sold separately)

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
